Class Deck

java.lang.Object
Deck
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
public class Deck extends Object implements Cloneable, Serializable
Deck objects represent a deck of cards for a game of Blackjack. Each deck has 52 standard playing cards, represented by card objects. The deck is able to be shuffled and dealt.
Author:
gunnarvonbergen
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Deck()
    No parameter constructor generates a new array list of cards that represents a full deck.
    Deck(Deck other)
    Copy constructor that allows for creating deep copies through the clone() method.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Deck
    clone()
    Clone method can be used to create a copy of a deck.
    void
    displayDeck()
    Displays all cards in the deck object's array list of cards.
    Card
    draw()
    Returns the removed card from the array list.
    ArrayList<Card>
    getCards()
    Gets the array list of cards.
    void
    shuffle()
    The shuffle method will loop through an array list of cards, generate a random number between 0 and 51, swapping the current card with the card at the randomly generated index.
    String
    toString()
    Displays the remaining cards in the deck.

  • Constructor Details

    • Deck

      public Deck()
      No parameter constructor generates a new array list of cards that represents a full deck.

    • Deck

      public Deck(Deck other)
      Copy constructor that allows for creating deep copies through the clone() method.
      Parameters:
      other - the deck intended to be copied.

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public Card draw()
      Returns the removed card from the array list.
      Returns:
      a card object taken from the "top of the deck".

    • shuffle

      public void shuffle()
      The shuffle method will loop through an array list of cards, generate a random number between 0 and 51, swapping the current card with the card at the randomly generated index. Currently, I am using the Collections.shuffle() method instead.

    • displayDeck

      public void displayDeck()
      Displays all cards in the deck object's array list of cards.

    • getCards

      public ArrayList<Card> getCards()
      Gets the array list of cards. Allows for the private array list to be referenced.
      Returns:
      an array list of cards that represents the deck.

    • clone

      public Deck clone()
      Clone method can be used to create a copy of a deck. Potential uses include the ability of making two players play the same hand or a replay system of sorts.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Displays the remaining cards in the deck. It is ineffective to list every card in the deck.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
